p: Liu’s group isolated a monoterpenoid, 7-acetyl-8,9-dihydroxy thymol 28 together with 7,8-dihydroxy-9-butyryl thymol 29 ( Figure 8) from dried flower buds of Lonicera japonica Thunb. Both derivatives exhibit significant antibacterial impact on S. aureus, E. coli, M. luteus, and B. cereus with IC 50 values ranging from 27.64 to 128.58 μM [ 33].
